commentBody:
Thanks for dredging up some history for us old Minnesota Herring-Chokers who were lucky enough to see the Lakers before they moved to the desert. My small town Lions club bused us kids 70 miles so we could see a game against the Celtics with Bob Cousey. Elgin Baylor was a Laker rookie and showed what the future would be--big men who could run the floor and do it all.

I think the character of Coach Kundla was reflected in the personality of the old Lakers. I don't recall a single team scandal. But that was then and now things are much more complex.

Thanks for the good times, Coach.
